page.title: 13PLAISH HALL, SHROPSHIRE
page.content: The Manor of Plaish is mentioned in the original Domesday Book and part of the present imposing Hall dates from the 15th century. A licence to rebuild the house as it stands today was granted in 1520,and the decorated brick chimneys are some of the finest examples of Tudor chimney work in the country. The present owner who lives in the house has restored it carefully and faithfully, as far as is possible. Unfortunately the minstrel's gallery was removed in the 1930's by a previous owner. The grounds are in the process of being cleared and replanted at the present time.The plan is to make the garden similar to those of the Tudor period.When completed this should be a showpiece in the County and enhance the already attractive hamlet of Plaish.
